result.execSummary:
Amos J. Ames was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Amos J. Ames was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amos J. Ames

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Amos J. Ames appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek for Amos J. Ames appeared by video. Svehlek states has reviewed criminal complaint - has not met with Defendant. Defendant has waived extradition. Court will withdraw until Svehlek speaks with Defendant. Court will set out in front of Branch II. Bond continued. adj. 01:36 PM
Extradition hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Amos J. Ames appeared by video, in custody. Court states warrant for arrest out of Missouri. Defendant has seen a copy of the Fugitive Complaint - has not contacted PD's office - family was to contact counsel. Court will set out. Court statement to charges. Sets bond. adj. 01:21 PM
Extradition hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
